Description:
You were born to survive, and raised to adapt.
<p>Whenever you are in the Injured State<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>, ''Made for This'' activates and you benefit from the following effects:
*Gain a '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">1</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">2</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">3</span>''' '''%''' '''''Haste<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>''''' '''Status Effect''' while running.
*Gain the '''''Endurance<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>''''' '''Status Effect''' for '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">6</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">8</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">10</span>''' '''seconds''' after completing a Healing action on another Survivor.


<p>''Made for This'' cannot be used when suffering from '''''Exhaustion''''', but does not cause the '''''Exhausted<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>''''' '''Status Effect'''.

You were born to survive, and raised to adapt.

Whenever you are in the Injured State, Made for This activates and you benefit from the following effects:

  • Gain a 1/2/3 % Haste Status Effect while running.
  • Gain the Endurance Status Effect for 6/8/10 seconds after completing a Healing action on another Survivor.

Made for This cannot be used when suffering from Exhaustion, but does not cause the Exhausted Status Effect.

"I didn't come here to be robot food!" - Gabriel Soma

Unlocks potential in your Aura-reading ability:
<p>While you are hooked:
* The Auras<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> of all Survivors<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 5px"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> are revealed to one another.
* Whenever the Killer is within '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">8</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">12</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">16</span>''' '''metres''' of your Hook, their Aura is revealed to all Survivors.
<p>While any other Survivor is hooked:
* The Auras of all other Survivors are revealed to you.
* Whenever the Killer is within '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">8</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">12</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">16</span>''' '''metres''' of the hooked Survivor, their Aura is revealed to you.

Unlocks potential in your Aura-reading ability:

While you are hooked:

  • The Auras of all Survivors are revealed to one another.
  • Whenever the Killer is within 8/12/16 metres of your Hook, their Aura is revealed to all Survivors.

While any other Survivor is hooked:

  • The Auras of all other Survivors are revealed to you.
  • Whenever the Killer is within 8/12/16 metres of the hooked Survivor, their Aura is revealed to you.

"Be kind to one another, We're all in this together" - Sujan, The Lost Tapes

Unlocks potential in one's Aura-reading ability. Paranoia paired with your horror of failure helps prepare you from repeating the same mistakes.

The Auras of 3 Generators in closest proximity to each other are revealed to you for 30/45/60 seconds, at the start of the Trial and each time a Generator is completed.

If you are holding a Map that can track Objectives, Generators revealed by Déjà Vu are added to the Map.

Start the Trial with '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">3 Tokens</span>'''.
<p>Whenever the Killer attempts to read your Aura<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>, ''Distortion'' activates, consuming '''<span class="luaClr clr clr6" style="color: #ff8800;">1 Token</span>''', and the following effects apply:
*'''Blocks''' your Aura from being read for the next '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">6</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">8</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">10</span>''' '''seconds'''.
*'''Suppresses''' the creation of Scratch Marks<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> for the next '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">6</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">8</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">10</span>''' '''seconds'''.

For every '''<span class="luaClr clr clr8" style="color: #d41c1c;">30 seconds</span>''' you are within the Killer's Terror Radius<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>, ''Distortion'' recharges '''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">1 Token</span>'''.
<p>''Distortion'' cannot accumulate more Tokens than its initial count.
<p>''Distortion'' does not activate when you are in the Dying State<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>.

Start the Trial with 3 Tokens.

Whenever the Killer attempts to read your Aura, Distortion activates, consuming 1 Token, and the following effects apply:

  • Blocks your Aura from being read for the next 6/8/10 seconds.
  • Suppresses the creation of Scratch Marks for the next 6/8/10 seconds.
For every 30 seconds you are within the Killer's Terror Radius, Distortion recharges 1 Token.

Distortion cannot accumulate more Tokens than its initial count.

Distortion does not activate when you are in the Dying State.

"Death Fooled by the Cloak of Falcon Feathers.
Sketch inspired by a few sleepless nights during winter. Exploration of Norse mythology: bravery can conceal your flaws, even when you are at your most vulnerable." - Jeff, pencil on tone paper, 12x12

Helping others heightens your morale.
* '''Increases''' your Altruistic Healing speed by '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">100 %</span>''' for the next '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">30</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">60</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">90</span>''' '''seconds''' whenever you rescue another Survivor from a Hook<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>

Helping others heightens your morale.
  • Increases your Altruistic Healing speed by 100 % for the next 30/60/90 seconds whenever you rescue another Survivor from a Hook

"I am confident we can all escape in one piece if we help each other."

Getting close to the Killer fills you with determination.

Every '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">15 seconds</span>''' you are within the Killer's Terror Radius<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>, while not being chased, ''Stake Out'' gains '''<span class="luaClr clr clr6" style="color: #ff8800;">1 Token</span>''', up to a maximum of '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">2</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">3</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">4</span>''' '''Tokens'''.
* When ''Stake Out'' has at least '''<span class="luaClr clr clr8" style="color: #d41c1c;">1 Token</span>''', Good Skill Checks<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> consume '''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">1 Token</span>''' and are considered Great Skill Checks, granting an additional Progression bonus of '''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">+1 %</span>'''.
* Great Skill Checks do not consume any Tokens.

Getting close to the Killer fills you with determination.

Every 15 seconds you are within the Killer's Terror Radius, while not being chased, Stake Out gains 1 Token, up to a maximum of 2/3/4 Tokens.

  • When Stake Out has at least 1 Token, Good Skill Checks consume 1 Token and are considered Great Skill Checks, granting an additional Progression bonus of +1 %.
  • Great Skill Checks do not consume any Tokens.

"I had you, I had you on your knees. You're runnin' scared because we had you. We're gonna close this case!" - Detective David Tapp

Unlocks potential in your Aura-reading ability.
<p>Whenever you finish healing another Survivor from the Dying State<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> to the Injured State<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>, ''Buckle Up'' applies its effects for the next '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">6</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">8</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">10</span>''' '''seconds''':
*'''Grants''' both you and the healed Survivor the '''''Endurance<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>''''' '''Status Effect'''.
*The Aura<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> of the Killer is revealed to you both.


Unlocks potential in your Aura-reading ability.

Whenever you finish healing another Survivor from the Dying State to the Injured State, Buckle Up applies its effects for the next 6/8/10 seconds:

  • Grants both you and the healed Survivor the Endurance Status Effect.
  • The Aura of the Killer is revealed to you both.

"Ghost beaters never leave a man behind." - Ash Williams

You do not make as much noise as others when quickly vaulting over obstacles or hiding in Lockers.
* '''Suppresses''' both the ''Loud Noise Notification'' and the sound effects triggered by rushing to vault Windows<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>, Pallets<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>, or rushing to enter or exit Lockers<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>.
<p>''Quick & Quiet'' has a cool-down of '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">30</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">25</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">20</span>''' '''seconds'''.

You do not make as much noise as others when quickly vaulting over obstacles or hiding in Lockers.
  • Suppresses both the Loud Noise Notification and the sound effects triggered by rushing to vault Windows, Pallets, or rushing to enter or exit Lockers.

Quick & Quiet has a cool-down of 30/25/20 seconds.

Unlocks potential in your Aura-reading ability:
* The Auras<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> of all other Survivors<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 5px"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> within '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">20</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">28</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">36</span>''' '''metres''' of your location are revealed to you.

Unlocks potential in your Aura-reading ability:
  • The Auras of all other Survivors within 20/28/36 metres of your location are revealed to you.

"We have to work as a team, I need you to survive so that I can survive!" - Dwight Fairfield

* When starting to run, break into a sprint at '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">150 %</span>''' of your normal Running Movement speed for '''<span class="luaClr clr clr6" style="color: #ff8800;">3 seconds</span>'''.
<p>''Sprint Burst'' causes the '''''Exhausted<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>''''' '''Status Effect''' for '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">60</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">50</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">40</span>''' '''seconds'''.

''Sprint Burst'' cannot be used when '''''Exhausted'''''.

  • When starting to run, break into a sprint at 150 % of your normal Running Movement speed for 3 seconds.

Sprint Burst causes the Exhausted Status Effect for 60/50/40 seconds.
Sprint Burst cannot be used when Exhausted.

"See you if you can catch up..." - Meg Thomas

After performing a Safe Hook Rescue on another Survivor, ''Deliverance'' activates:
*Causes your next Self-Unhook attempt to always succeed.
*Causes the '''''Broken<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>''''' '''Status Effect''' for '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">100</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">80</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">60</span>''' '''seconds''' after unhooking yourself.

''Deliverance'' is not available during the second Hook Stage or if you are hooked as the last living Survivor in the Trial, regardless of your Hook Stage then.

After performing a Safe Hook Rescue on another Survivor, Deliverance activates:
  • Causes your next Self-Unhook attempt to always succeed.
  • Causes the Broken Status Effect for 100/80/60 seconds after unhooking yourself.

Deliverance is not available during the second Hook Stage or if you are hooked as the last living Survivor in the Trial, regardless of your Hook Stage then.

"I was raised by a strict man who taught me how to make the best of a bad situation." - Adam Francis

Unlocks potential in your Aura-reading ability.
<p>Once all Generators<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> are completed, ''Wake Up!'' activates:
*The Auras<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> of the Exit Gate Switches<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> are revealed to you within '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">128 metres</span>'''.
*Your Aura is revealed to all other Survivors within '''<span class="luaClr clr clr6" style="color: #ff8800;">128 metres</span>''' of your location while opening an Exit Gate<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>.
*'''Increases''' your Gate Opening speed by '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">15</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">20</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">25</span>''' '''%'''.


Unlocks potential in your Aura-reading ability.

Once all Generators are completed, Wake Up! activates:

  • The Auras of the Exit Gate Switches are revealed to you within 128 metres.
  • Your Aura is revealed to all other Survivors within 128 metres of your location while opening an Exit Gate.
  • Increases your Gate Opening speed by 15/20/25 %.

"Ok, look. If we survive the next 24 hours, then I'll take you out on a real date." - Quentin Smith

You are motivated in dire situations.
* '''Increases''' your Action speeds in Repairing, Healing, Sabotaging, Unhooking, Vaulting, Cleansing, Blessing, Opening, and Unlocking by '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">3</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">6</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">9</span>''' '''%''' when in the Injured State<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>.

You are motivated in dire situations.
  • Increases your Action speeds in Repairing, Healing, Sabotaging, Unhooking, Vaulting, Cleansing, Blessing, Opening, and Unlocking by 3/6/9 % when in the Injured State.

"Focus, even in these desperate times."

You know how to get the most out of your tools.

Hiding inside a Locker<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> for '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">14</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">13</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">12</span>''' '''seconds''' while carrying a depleted Item<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> will replenish its Charges to '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">99 %</span>'''.

Each use of ''Built to Last'' reduces this percentage by '''<span class="luaClr clr clr6" style="color: #ff8800;">-33 %</span>'''.

You know how to get the most out of your tools.

Hiding inside a Locker for 14/13/12 seconds while carrying a depleted Item will replenish its Charges to 99 %.
Each use of Built to Last reduces this percentage by -33 %.

"Architecture is the soul of civilisation." - Felix Richter

When people bring you on to their project, they do so because of the unexpected magic you bring to your performance.
<p>Whenever you are Healthy<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>, ''Dramaturgy'' activates:
*While running, press the ''Active Ability button'' to run with knees high for '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">0.5 seconds</span>''' to gain a '''<span class="luaClr clr clr6" style="color: #ff8800;">+25 %</span>''' '''''Haste<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>''''' '''Status Effect''' for '''<span class="luaClr clr clr8" style="color: #d41c1c;">2 seconds</span>''', followed by one of the following effects:
**Suffer from the '''''Exposed<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>''''' '''Status Effect''' for '''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">12 seconds</span>'''.
**Extend the duration of the '''''Haste<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>''''' '''Status Effect''' for another '''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">2 seconds</span>'''.
**Scream, but without notifying the Killer.
**Receive a random Item<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> of '''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">Rare</span>''' Rarity, with a random selection of [[Add-ons]]<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> attached to it, automatically dropping any previously held Item.
*''The same effect cannot happen twice in a row.''


<p>''Dramaturgy'' causes the '''''Exhausted<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>''''' '''Status Effect''' for '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">60</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">50</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">40</span>''' '''seconds'''.

You have had your share of scrapes and bruises, but luck is always on your side.

<p>Each '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">1 second</span>''' spent healing another Survivor recharges ''Lucky Break'' by '''<span class="luaClr clr clr6" style="color: #ff8800;">1 second</span>''' up to its maximum Effect duration.
<p>''Lucky Break'' also deactivates whenever you are Healthy<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> or in the Dying State<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>.

You have had your share of scrapes and bruises, but luck is always on your side.

Whenever you are in the Injured State, Lucky Break activates:

Each 1 second spent healing another Survivor recharges Lucky Break by 1 second up to its maximum Effect duration.

Lucky Break also deactivates whenever you are Healthy or in the Dying State.

Not even close." - Yui Kimura

Your agility and cat-like relexes are incomparable.

''Balanced Landing'' cannot be used when '''''Exhausted'''''.

* ''Adrenaline'' is on hold if you are disabled at the moment it triggers and will instead activate upon being freed.

Adrenaline ignores an existing Exhaustion timer, but causes the Exhausted Status Effect for 60/50/40 seconds.

*You become injured and suffer from the '''''Broken<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>''''' '''Status Effect''' for the next '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">80</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">70</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">60</span>''' '''seconds'''.

*Whenever the Killer comes within '''<span class="luaClr clr clr8" style="color: #d41c1c;">14 metres</span>''' of the ''Trapped Generator'' their Aura is revealed to all Survivors.
*Damaging the Generator destroys the '''Wiretap'''.


<p>The Auras<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> of ''Trapped Generators'' are revealed to all Survivors in '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">yellow</span>'''.

You know that the best way to stay one step ahead is to keep tabs on the competition.

After repairing Generators for a total of 50 %, Wiretap activates:

  • After continuing to repair any Generator for another 3 seconds, you can press the Active Ability button to install a Wiretap, which stays active for 100/110/120 seconds.
  • Whenever the Killer comes within 14 metres of the Trapped Generator their Aura is revealed to all Survivors.
  • Damaging the Generator destroys the Wiretap.

The Auras of Trapped Generators are revealed to all Survivors in yellow.

'''Increases''' your Repair speed by '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">6</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">8</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">10</span>''' '''%''' for each Survivor<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 5px"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> within '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">4 metres</span>''' of your location other than yourself, up to a maximum of '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">18</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">24</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">30</span>''' '''%'''.
* This effect is also extended to all other Survivors within that range.

Increases your Repair speed by 6/8/10 % for each Survivor within 4 metres of your location other than yourself, up to a maximum of 18/24/30 %.
  • This effect is also extended to all other Survivors within that range.

Survivors can only be affected by one instance of Prove Thyself at a time.

"Show me what you can do!" - Dwight Fairfield

You risk it all to help those in need.

*Scratch Marks<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> and Pools of Blood<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> are suppressed.
*Additional '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">7 %</span>''' '''''Haste<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>''''' '''Status Effect''', boosting their Movement speed.

''Guardian'' reveals the Killer's Aura<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> to you for '''<span class="luaClr clr clr6" style="color: #ff8800;">8 seconds</span>'''.

Guardian reveals the Killer's Aura to you for 8 seconds.

*Whenever you become injured, you retain the Movement Speed burst for '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">2 additional seconds</span>'''.

''Overcome'' causes the '''''Exhausted<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>''''' '''Status Effect''' for '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">60</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">50</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">40</span>''' '''seconds'''.

<p>''Background Player'' causes the '''''Exhausted<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>''''' '''Status Effect''' for '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">60</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">50</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">40</span>''' '''seconds'''.
<p>''Background Player'' cannot be used when '''''Exhausted'''''.

You are not usually the centre of attention and in some cases, this can be a good thing.

When another Survivor is picked up, Background Player activates for the next 10 seconds:

Background Player causes the Exhausted Status Effect for 60/50/40 seconds.

"You forget about me?" - Renato Lyra

No amount of distraction will shake you from your primary task.
<p>When you are chased by the Killer, ''Troubleshooter'' activates:
*The Aura<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> of the Generator<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> with the most progress is revealed to you.
*The Aura of the Killer is revealed to you for '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">4</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">5</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">6</span>''' '''seconds''' after dropping a Pallet<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>.


<p>These effects linger for '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">6</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">8</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">10</span>''' '''seconds''' after ending the Chase, after which ''Troubleshooter'' deactivates.

No amount of distraction will shake you from your primary task.

When you are chased by the Killer, Troubleshooter activates:

  • The Aura of the Generator with the most progress is revealed to you.
  • The Aura of the Killer is revealed to you for 4/5/6 seconds after dropping a Pallet.

These effects linger for 6/8/10 seconds after ending the Chase, after which Troubleshooter deactivates.

"Nothing gets done around here if I don't do it." - Gabriel Soma

Unlocks potential in your Aura-reading ability:
<p>For the duration of the Killer<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 5px"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> carrying another Survivor<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 5px"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>, you see the Aura<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> of every Hook<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> within '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">56 metres</span>''' of the carried Survivor's pick-up location:
*The Auras of regular Hooks are revealed to you in '''<span class="luaClr clr clr16" style="color: #ffffff;">white</span>'''.
*The Auras of '''Scourge Hooks''' are revealed to you in '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">yellow</span>'''.


<p>Unlocks the ability to sabotage Hooks without needing a Toolboxes|Toolbox<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>:

Unlocks potential in your Aura-reading ability:

For the duration of the Killer carrying another Survivor, you see the Aura of every Hook within 56 metres of the carried Survivor's pick-up location:

  • The Auras of regular Hooks are revealed to you in white.
  • The Auras of Scourge Hooks are revealed to you in yellow.

Unlocks the ability to sabotage Hooks without needing a Toolbox:

  • Sabotaging a Hook without a Toolbox takes 2.3 seconds.
  • That Sabotage action has a cool-down of 70/65/60 seconds.

You are accustomed to being hunted by malicious forces, and you have begun using it to your advantage.
<p>After repairing Generators<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> for a total of '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">55</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">50</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">45</span>''' '''seconds''', ''Repressed Alliance'' activates:
* Press the ''Active Ability button'' to call upon The Entity<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> to block the Generator you are currently repairing for '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">30 seconds</span>''', after which ''Repressed Alliance'' deactivates.
* The Aura<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> of the blocked Generator is revealed to all Survivors in '''<span class="luaClr clr clr16" style="color: #ffffff;">white</span>'''.
<p>''Repressed Alliance'' can only be triggered when no other Survivors are repairing your Generator.

You are accustomed to being hunted by malicious forces, and you have begun using it to your advantage.

After repairing Generators for a total of 55/50/45 seconds, Repressed Alliance activates:

  • Press the Active Ability button to call upon The Entity to block the Generator you are currently repairing for 30 seconds, after which Repressed Alliance deactivates.
  • The Aura of the blocked Generator is revealed to all Survivors in white.

Repressed Alliance can only be triggered when no other Survivors are repairing your Generator.

Using whatever is at hand, you stab your aggressor in an ultimate attempt to escape.
<p>After being unhooked or unhooking yourself, ''Decisive Strike'' activates for the next '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">40</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">50</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">60</span>''' '''seconds''':
*When being grabbed or picked up by the Killer, succeed a Skill Check<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> to automatically escape their grasp, stunning them for '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">3 seconds</span>'''.
*Successfuly stunning the Killer will disable ''Decisive Strike'' for the remainder of the Trial and result in you becoming the '''''Obsession<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>'''''.


<p>While ''Decisive Strike'' is active, performing ''Conspicuous Actions'' will deactivate it for the remainder of the Trial.
<p>''Decisive Strike'' deactivates once the Exit Gates<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> are powered.
<p>Increases the Odds of becoming the initial '''''Obsession''''' of the Killer by '''+100 %'''.

''The Killer can only be '''obsessed''' with one Survivor at a time.''

Using whatever is at hand, you stab your aggressor in an ultimate attempt to escape.

After being unhooked or unhooking yourself, Decisive Strike activates for the next 40/50/60 seconds:

  • When being grabbed or picked up by the Killer, succeed a Skill Check to automatically escape their grasp, stunning them for 3 seconds.
  • Successfuly stunning the Killer will disable Decisive Strike for the remainder of the Trial and result in you becoming the Obsession.

While Decisive Strike is active, performing Conspicuous Actions will deactivate it for the remainder of the Trial.

Decisive Strike deactivates once the Exit Gates are powered.

Increases the Odds of becoming the initial Obsession of the Killer by +100 %.
The Killer can only be obsessed with one Survivor at a time.

"There is nothing to be scared of." - Laurie Strode

Pain hurts you as much as anyone, but you would prefer others do not know that.

After being unhooked or unhooking yourself, instantly gain 40/45/50 % to your Healing progress.

* '''Extends''' the duration of their '''''Endurance<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>''''' '''Status Effect''' by '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">6</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">8</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">10</span>''' '''seconds'''.

You are aware of your surroundings and share the information with others.

*If the Killer<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 5px"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> downs a Survivor while you are repairing a Generator, you see the Auras of all other Survivors for '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">8</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">9</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">10</span>''' '''seconds'''.

Fighting back against the Ravage motivates and inspires you.

It is hard to keep up with you, but it does not stop people from trying.
<p>Whenever you finish healing another Survivor, ''Teamwork: Power of Two'' activates, and both you and the healed Survivor benefit from the following effect:
*Grants a '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">5 %</span>''' '''''Haste<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>''''' '''Status Effect''' for as long as you stay within '''<span class="luaClr clr clr6" style="color: #ff8800;">12 metres</span>''' of one another or one of you loses a Health State<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>.

It is hard to keep up with you, but it does not stop people from trying.

<p>Increases the Odds of becoming the initial '''''Obsession''''' of the Killer by '''+100 %'''.
<p>''The Killer can only be '''obsessed''' with one Survivor at a time.''

Evil has a way of always finding you.

After triggering your third Protection Hit, Mettle of Man activates:

The Killer can only be obsessed with one Survivor at a time.

* '''Increases''' their Action speeds in Healing, Unlocking, Cleansing, and Blessing by '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">12</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">14</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">16</span>''' '''%'''.

You are an expert in combat medicine.

Patients leave your care reinvigorated.

Upon completing a Healing action on another Survivor, they benefit from the following effect until the next time they take damage:

  • Increases their Action speeds in Healing, Unlocking, Cleansing, and Blessing by 12/14/16 %.

A lifetime of chasing the darkness has taught you that the best disinfectant is light.
*After a successful ''Killer Blind'', the Killer suffers from the '''''Blindness<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>''''' '''Status Effect''' for '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">20</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">25</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">30</span>''' '''seconds'''.

You work best alone.

When it is just you and your pursuer, you know how to disappear.
<p>Whenever you are the only Survivor in the Trial, who is not either in the Dying State<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>, hooked, or already dead, ''Low Profile'' activates:

You work best alone.

When it is just you and your pursuer, you know how to disappear.

Whenever you are the only Survivor in the Trial, who is not either in the Dying State, hooked, or already dead, Low Profile activates:

  • Suppresses your Pools of Blood, Scratch Marks, and Grunts of Pain for 70/80/90 seconds.

You lock in with your co-star, engaging with and reacting to each other on a higher level.
<p>Whenever you are inside the Terror Radius<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>, ''Scene Partner'' activates:
*Looking at the Killer causes you to scream, which reveals their Aura<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> for '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">3</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">4</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">5</span>''' '''seconds'''.
*There is a chance of '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">50 %</span>''' that you will scream again, extending the Aura-reveal duration by another '''<span class="luaClr clr clr6" style="color: #ff8800;">2 seconds</span>'''.


<p>''Scene Partner'' has a cool-down of '''<span class="luaClr clr clr8" style="color: #d41c1c;">60 seconds</span>'''.

You lock in with your co-star, engaging with and reacting to each other on a higher level.

Whenever you are inside the Terror Radius, Scene Partner activates:

  • Looking at the Killer causes you to scream, which reveals their Aura for 3/4/5 seconds.
  • There is a chance of 50 % that you will scream again, extending the Aura-reveal duration by another 2 seconds.

Scene Partner has a cool-down of 60 seconds.

"This is not in the script!" - Nicolas Cage

When you heal another Survivor<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 5px"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> for the equivalent of '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">1</span>''' Health State<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>, ''Renewal'' activates:
*The next time you are unhooked or unhook yourself, you suffer from the '''''Broken<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>''''' '''Status Effect''' until ''Renewal'' deactivates.
*You are automatically healed '''<span class="luaClr clr clr6" style="color: #ff8800;">1 Health State</span>''' after '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">28</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">24</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">20</span>''' '''seconds'''.

While ''Renewal'' is active, the following conditions will deactivate it:
*Successfully being healed by ''Renewal''.
*Being put into the Dying State<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> before the timer elapses.

''Renewal'' does not activate if you already suffer from the '''''Broken''''' '''Status Effect'''.

When you heal another Survivor for the equivalent of 1 Health State, Renewal activates:
  • The next time you are unhooked or unhook yourself, you suffer from the Broken Status Effect until Renewal deactivates.
  • You are automatically healed 1 Health State after 28/24/20 seconds.

While Renewal is active, the following conditions will deactivate it:

  • Successfully being healed by Renewal.
  • Being put into the Dying State before the timer elapses.
Renewal does not activate if you already suffer from the Broken Status Effect.

The more the situation becomes compromised, the more determined you become to complete the operation.
<p>When another Survivor<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 5px"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> loses a Health State<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> within '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">32 metres</span>''' of your location while you are in the Injured State<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>, you benefit from the following effect:
* Grants '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">40</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">45</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">50</span>''' '''%''' of your missing Healing Progression to your Health Bar.

The more the situation becomes compromised, the more determined you become to complete the operation.

When another Survivor loses a Health State within 32 metres of your location while you are in the Injured State, you benefit from the following effect:

  • Grants 40/45/50 % of your missing Healing Progression to your Health Bar.

Where others see junk, you see valuable improvised tools.
<p>While holding a depleted ''Toolbox'', ''Scavenger'' activates:
*Succeeding at ''Great Repairing Skill Checks'' grants '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">1 Token</span>''', up to a maximum of '''<span class="luaClr clr clr6" style="color: #ff8800;">5 Tokens</span>'''.
*Reaching the maximum number of Tokens automatically consumes them and fully recharges the ''Toolbox''.
*Recharging a ''Toolbox'' will reduce your Repair speed by '''<span class="luaClr clr clr8" style="color: #d41c1c;">-50 %</span>''' for the next '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">40</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">35</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">30</span>''' '''seconds'''.


<p>''Scavenger'' grants the ability to rummage through an opened Chest<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> once per Trial and will guarantee a basic Toolbox<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>.

Where others see junk, you see valuable improvised tools.

While holding a depleted Toolbox, Scavenger activates:

  • Succeeding at Great Repairing Skill Checks grants 1 Token, up to a maximum of 5 Tokens.
  • Reaching the maximum number of Tokens automatically consumes them and fully recharges the Toolbox.
  • Recharging a Toolbox will reduce your Repair speed by -50 % for the next 40/35/30 seconds.

Scavenger grants the ability to rummage through an opened Chest once per Trial and will guarantee a basic Toolbox.

"It's amazing what people will throw away around here." - Gabriel Soma

Your arcane abilities have adapted to The Entity's Realm after centuries of wandering, granting you unprecedented control over its many devices.
<p>After repairing Generators<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> for a total of '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">12</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">10</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">8</span>''' '''uninterrupted seconds''', press the ''Active Ability button'' to activate ''Potential Energy'':
*Continuing to repair the Generator will charge ''Potential Energy'' instead of progressing the Generator.
*'''Converts''' '''<span class="luaClr clr clr6" style="color: #ff8800;">1.5 %</span>''' of Repair progression into '''<span class="luaClr clr clr8" style="color: #d41c1c;">1 Token</span>''', up to a maximum of '''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">20 Tokens</span>'''.
*Missing Skill Checks<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> results in losing some Tokens.


<p>While ''Potential Energy'' has at least '''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">1 Token</span>''', press the ''Active Ability button'' while repairing a Generator to instantly progress it by '''<span class="luaClr clr clr10" style="color: #0e98ff;">1 % per Token</span>''', consuming all remaining Tokens and deactivating ''Potential Energy''.
<p>''Potential Energy'' loses all Tokens and deactivates upon losing a Health State<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>.

Your arcane abilities have adapted to The Entity's Realm after centuries of wandering, granting you unprecedented control over its many devices.

After repairing Generators for a total of 12/10/8 uninterrupted seconds, press the Active Ability button to activate Potential Energy:

  • Continuing to repair the Generator will charge Potential Energy instead of progressing the Generator.
  • Converts 1.5 % of Repair progression into 1 Token, up to a maximum of 20 Tokens.
  • Missing Skill Checks results in losing some Tokens.

While Potential Energy has at least 1 Token, press the Active Ability button while repairing a Generator to instantly progress it by 1 % per Token, consuming all remaining Tokens and deactivating Potential Energy.

Potential Energy loses all Tokens and deactivates upon losing a Health State.

"When you look a layer deeper, you realise... everything is connected." - Vittorio Toscano

Your mind and body are honed for great feats, allowing you to push through with extra effort when necessary.
<p>Once you are one Hook away from instant death, ''Blood Rush'' activates:
*Press the ''Active Ability button'' to lose a Health State<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> and instantly recover from the '''''Exhausted<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>''''' '''Status Effect'''.
*Causes the '''''Broken<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>''''' '''Status Effect''' for '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">28</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">24</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">20</span>''' '''seconds''', while you are automatically healing back to Healthy<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>.
*Cancels the healing effect upon taking damage.


<p>''Blood Rush'' is disabled for the remainder of the Trial after use.

Your mind and body are honed for great feats, allowing you to push through with extra effort when necessary.

Once you are one Hook away from instant death, Blood Rush activates:

  • Press the Active Ability button to lose a Health State and instantly recover from the Exhausted Status Effect.
  • Causes the Broken Status Effect for 28/24/20 seconds, while you are automatically healing back to Healthy.
  • Cancels the healing effect upon taking damage.

Blood Rush is disabled for the remainder of the Trial after use.

"Just gotta... push through!" - Renato Lyra

You have a careful eye that notices what many overlook.

Start the Trial with '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">3 Tokens</span>''':
* When a Chest<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> has already been opened, consume '''<span class="luaClr clr clr6" style="color: #ff8800;">1 Token</span>''' to rummage through it for an Item<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>.
* Rummage through Chests '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">40</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">60</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">80</span>''' '''%''' faster.
<p>''Rummaging is only available once per Chest.''

You have a careful eye that notices what many overlook.

Start the Trial with 3 Tokens:

  • When a Chest has already been opened, consume 1 Token to rummage through it for an Item.
  • Rummage through Chests 40/60/80 % faster.

Rummaging is only available once per Chest.

You have noticed that people pay attention to whatever makes the loudest noise.

After repairing a Generator<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> for at least '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">3 seconds</span>''', its Aura<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> is highlighted to you in '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">yellow</span>'''.
* The Generator stays highlighted until it is either fully repaired, you start repairing another Generator, or enter a Locker<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>.
* Entering a Locker will trigger a ''Loud Noise Notification'' for the Killer at the highlighted Generator's location.
<p>''Red Herring'' has a cool-down of '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">60</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">50</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">40</span>''' '''seconds'''.

You have noticed that people pay attention to whatever makes the loudest noise.

After repairing a Generator for at least 3 seconds, its Aura is highlighted to you in yellow.

  • The Generator stays highlighted until it is either fully repaired, you start repairing another Generator, or enter a Locker.
  • Entering a Locker will trigger a Loud Noise Notification for the Killer at the highlighted Generator's location.

Red Herring has a cool-down of 60/50/40 seconds.
"The news edit out what is burdensome and complex. which is the truth." - Zarina Kassir

It is as if a latent part of yourself has awakened.

You feel like you can reach out beyond yourself for assistance.
<p>When you or the '''''Obsession<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>''''' are injured, you both see each other's Auras<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>.
* After healing the '''''Obsession''''' or being healed by the '''''Obsession''''', you both gain the '''''Haste<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>''''' '''Status Effect''', moving at an increased speed of '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">5</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">6</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">7</span>''' '''%''' until you are no longer within '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">16 metres</span>''' of each other.
* If you are the '''''Obsession''''', ''Blood Pact'' deactivates.
<p>Reduces the Odds of becoming the initial '''''Obsession''''' of the Killer by '''-100 %'''.
<p>''The Killer can only be '''obsessed''' with one Survivor at a time.''

It is as if a latent part of yourself has awakened.

You feel like you can reach out beyond yourself for assistance.

When you or the Obsession are injured, you both see each other's Auras.

  • After healing the Obsession or being healed by the Obsession, you both gain the Haste Status Effect, moving at an increased speed of 5/6/7 % until you are no longer within 16 metres of each other.
  • If you are the Obsession, Blood Pact deactivates.

Reduces the Odds of becoming the initial Obsession of the Killer by -100 %.

The Killer can only be obsessed with one Survivor at a time.

An unnatural tingle warns you of impending doom.
<p>Whenever the Killer<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 5px"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> is within '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">36 metres</span>''' of your location and looking at you with a clear line of sight, ''Spine Chill'' activates:
*'''Increases''' your Action speeds in Repairing, Healing, Sabotaging, Unhooking, Cleansing, Blessing, Opening, and Unlocking by '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">2</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">4</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">6</span>''' '''%'''.
**This effect lingers for '''<span class="luaClr clr clr6" style="color: #ff8800;">0.5 seconds</span>''' after the Killer loses line of sight or exits the range.

An unnatural tingle warns you of impending doom.

Whenever the Killer is within 36 metres of your location and looking at you with a clear line of sight, Spine Chill activates:

  • Increases your Action speeds in Repairing, Healing, Sabotaging, Unhooking, Cleansing, Blessing, Opening, and Unlocking by 2/4/6 %.
    • This effect lingers for 0.5 seconds after the Killer loses line of sight or exits the range.
"There is a voice that doesn't use words. Listen.." - Sassy, The Lost Tapes

Lady Luck always seems to be throwing something good your way.

When retrieving an Item<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> from a Chest<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>, there is a chance an [[Add-on]]<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> will be attached to it.
* '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">100 %</span>''' chance for an Add-on of '''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">Very Rare</span>''' Rarity or lower.
* '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">10</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">25</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">50</span>''' '''%''' chance for a second Add-on of '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">Uncommon</span>''' Rarity or lower.
<p>''Ace in the Hole'' allows you to keep any Add-ons your Item has equipped upon escaping.

Lady Luck always seems to be throwing something good your way.

When retrieving an Item from a Chest, there is a chance an Add-on will be attached to it.

  • 100 % chance for an Add-on of Very Rare Rarity or lower.
  • 10/25/50 % chance for a second Add-on of Uncommon Rarity or lower.

Ace in the Hole allows you to keep any Add-ons your Item has equipped upon escaping.

"Everything that glitters isn't gold. But gold isn't worth a damn in this place, so this should come in handy." - Ace Visconti

You keep a careful eye on objectives when they are slipping away.
<p>While repairing Generators<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>, succeed '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">5</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">4</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">3</span>''' Good or Great Skill Checks<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> to activate ''Rookie Spirit'' for the remainder of the Trial:
*Once active, the Auras<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> of any regressing Generators are revealed to you.

You keep a careful eye on objectives when they are slipping away.

While repairing Generators, succeed 5/4/3 Good or Great Skill Checks to activate Rookie Spirit for the remainder of the Trial:

  • Once active, the Auras of any regressing Generators are revealed to you.
"I'll stop this, lieutenant. I promise." - Leon Scott Kennedy

As more of your friends fall to the Killer, you become shrouded in isolation and the Killer's Aura-reading abilities towards you are disrupted.
<p>Each time a Survivor other than yourself is killed or sacrificed, ''Sole Survivor'' gains '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">1 Token</span>''', up to a maximum of '''<span class="luaClr clr clr6" style="color: #ff8800;">3 Tokens</span>''':
*Grants a stack-able radius of '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">20</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">22</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">24</span>''' '''metres''' per Token around you, up to a maximum of '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">60</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">66</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">72</span>''' '''metres''', within which you are immune to the Killer's Aura-reading abilities.

When you are the Last Survivor Standing, you benefit from the following effects:
*'''Increases''' your Repair speed by '''<span class="luaClr clr clr8" style="color: #d41c1c;">+75 %</span>'''.
*'''Increases''' your Gate and Hatch Opening speeds by '''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">+50 %</span>'''.

Increases the Odds of becoming the initial '''''Obsession''''' of the Killer by '''+100 %'''.
<p>''The Killer can only be '''obsessed''' with one Survivor at a time.''

As more of your friends fall to the Killer, you become shrouded in isolation and the Killer's Aura-reading abilities towards you are disrupted.

Each time a Survivor other than yourself is killed or sacrificed, Sole Survivor gains 1 Token, up to a maximum of 3 Tokens:

  • Grants a stack-able radius of 20/22/24 metres per Token around you, up to a maximum of 60/66/72 metres, within which you are immune to the Killer's Aura-reading abilities.
When you are the Last Survivor Standing, you benefit from the following effects:
  • Increases your Repair speed by +75 %.
  • Increases your Gate and Hatch Opening speeds by +50 %.
Increases the Odds of becoming the initial Obsession of the Killer by +100 %.

The Killer can only be obsessed with one Survivor at a time.
